context.p: StellarProtect supports USB storage device access control. In StellarProtect agent side, when USB device control has been enabled, every time users plug in USB devices, the agent will prompt a message for users to confirm if the USB device access is allowed. In order to facilitate the trusted USB device access, users can add the USB device information into the Device Control list, allowing the specified device to access directly without further check.

step.cmd: Click the All group on the Agents screen. The Agents screen displays a list of agents managed by StellarOne.
Navigate to the target agent or agent group and click the corresponding link under the Policy Inheritance header.
Make sure the Device Control toggle is switched on.
Click Add. The Add Trusted USB Device window appears.
Specify at least one of the following information for the trusted USB device.
Click OK to complete the setting.
Check if the USB device is successfully added in the device control list.

To edit the USB device information, select the USB device and click the edit icon under the Actions header. A pop-up window appears. Edit the USB device information in the related text fields and then click OK.
To remove a USB device from trusted list, choose either way listed below.

li.p: For removing mutiple USB devices at the same time, select the USB devices and click the Delete button next to the +Add button.
For removing only one USB devices, click the edit icon under the Actions header.

info.p: A pop-up Notification window appears. Click Confirm to delete the USB device(s).
